00.orig_text: US stock markets tumble on 'Black Monday' anniversary
00.text: US stock markets tumble on 'Black Monday' anniversary

02.orig_text: Some say history tends to repeat itself.
02.text: Some say history tends to repeat itself.

03.orig_text: Today marked a day in history, when 20 years ago, the United States Dow Jones Industrial Average market crashed, on what is known as 'Black Monday'.
03.text: Today marked a day in history, when 20 years ago, the United States Dow Jones Industrial Average market crashed, on what is known as 'Black Monday'.

04.orig_text: The crash sent the market tumbling down 508 points, losing nearly 24%.
04.text: The crash sent the market tumbling down 508 points, losing nearly 24%.

05.orig_text: On Friday, the Dow Jones nearly broke that record when the market closed at -366.94 points, down almost three percent.
05.text: On Friday, the Dow Jones nearly broke that record when the market closed at -366.94 points, down almost three percent.

06.orig_text: Several factors could be to blame for the loss, one being Turkey's government approving a measure on October 18 to send Turkish troops into Iraq in an attempt to take out militants of the Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK).
06.text: Several factors could be to blame for the loss, one being Turkey's government approving a measure on October 18 to send Turkish troops into Iraq in an attempt to take out militants of the Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK).

07.orig_text: This sent oil prices skyrocketing to the highest prices in history, with the highest record being just over US$89.00, which was set on October 18.
07.text: This sent oil prices skyrocketing to the highest prices in history, with the highest record being just over US$89.00, which was set on October 18.

08.orig_text: Fears that the housing market in the U.S. has come to a standstill has also lead Caterpillar Inc., which manufactures and sells construction equipment to issue a warning that the standstill would cause profits to drop, and the American economy to be severely hurt.
08.text: Fears that the housing market in the U.S. has come to a standstill has also lead Caterpillar Inc., which manufactures and sells construction equipment to issue a warning that the standstill would cause profits to drop, and the American economy to be severely hurt.

09.orig_text: On Friday their stocks lost nearly six percent to close at $73.57.
09.text: On Friday their stocks lost nearly six percent to close at $73.57.

10.orig_text: Investors and experts of the markets are disturbed by the losses calling the situation ugly.
10.text: Investors and experts of the markets are disturbed by the losses calling the situation ugly.

12.orig_text: A company like Caterpillar should be a poster child for global growth and benefits of the weak dollar.
12.text: A company like Caterpillar should be a poster child for global growth and benefits of the weak dollar.

13.orig_text: It makes you question: Is global growth really that strong?
13.text: It makes you question: Is global growth really that strong?

14.orig_text: Has the earnings kick from the weak dollar played itself out?``
14.text: Has the earnings kick from the weak dollar played itself out?``

15.orig_text: said Bell Curve Trading chief strategy expert, Bill Strazzullo.
15.text: said Bell Curve Trading chief strategy expert, Bill Strazzullo.

16.orig_text: Others believe that the losses were a way of emotionally responding to the events of 'Black Monday.
16.text: Others believe that the losses were a way of emotionally responding to the events of 'Black Monday.

17.orig_text: ' ``Some of the earnings reports were a little disappointing but not that bad.
17.text: ' ``Some of the earnings reports were a little disappointing but not that bad.

18.orig_text: I think we're responding emotionally to the 20th anniversary of the October 1987 stock market crash.
18.text: I think we're responding emotionally to the 20th anniversary of the October 1987 stock market crash.

19.orig_text: I'd like to laugh except it hurts,`` said T Rowe Price Head trader, Andy Brooks.
19.text: I'd like to laugh except it hurts,`` said T Rowe Price Head trader, Andy Brooks.

20.orig_text: The NASDAQ also took heavy losses to close down 74.15 points or -2.64%, closing at 2,725.16.
20.text: The NASDAQ also took heavy losses to close down 74.15 points or -2.64%, closing at 2,725.16.

21.orig_text: The S&P 500 was also hit hard, losing 39.45 points, or -2.56%, closing at 1,500.63.
21.text: The S&P 500 was also hit hard, losing 39.45 points, or -2.56%, closing at 1,500.63.
